array.empty_padding.description: When true, empty arrays are padded with a space.

array.multiline.element_count.description: When an array has this number of elements or more, print it onto multiple lines.

array.multiline.leading_comma.description: Whether to use a leading comma when an array is printed on multiple lines.

array.multiline.min_length.description: No matter how many elements an array has, if it is shorter than this length, keep it on one line.

array.padding.description: When true, non-empty arrays are padded with spaces.

binary_operators.padding.description: Whether to pad binary operators with spaces.

brackets.padding.description: When true, bracketed accessors are padded with spaces.

for_loop_semicolons.padding.description: When true, insert a space after for loop semicolons.

function_call.empty_padding.description: When true, function calls with no arguments are padded with a space.

function_call.multiline.element_count.description: When a function call has this number of arguments, split them onto multiple lines.

function_call.multiline.leading_comma.description: Whether to use a leading comma when function call arguments are printed on multiple lines.

function_call.multiline.min_length.description: No matter how many arguments a function call has, if they can be printed inline in this many columns or less, keep them on one line.

function_call.padding.description: Whether to pad function call arguments with spaces.

function_declaration.empty_padding.description: When true, pad function declarations that have no parameters with a space.

function_declaration.group_to_block_spac.description: How to space from the function parameters to the function block.

function_declaration.multiline.element_c.description: When a function declaration has this number of parameters, split them onto multiple lines.

function_declaration.multiline.leading_c.description: Whether to use a leading comma when function declaration parameters are printed on multiple lines.

function_declaration.multiline.min_lengt.description: No matter how many arguments a function call has, if they can be printed in this many columns or less, keep them on one line.

function_declaration.padding.description: Whether to pad non-empty function calls with spaces.

indent_size.description: Each indent level or tab is equivalent to this many spaces.

keywords.block_to_keyword_spacing.description: Spacing for keywords following a block.

keywords.empty_group_spacing.description: Whether to pad empty keyword groups.

keywords.group_to_block_spacing.description: Spacing from a keyword group to the following block.

keywords.padding_inside_group.description: Whether to pad inside non-empty keyword groups.

keywords.spacing_to_block.description: Spacing from a keyword to the following block.

keywords.spacing_to_group.description: Whether to space a keyword from following group.

max_columns.description: When rendering a delimited item (struct, array, function call, function declaration parameters), this is the maximum number of columns to render on one line before splitting the elements onto multiple lines.

parentheses.padding.description: Whether to pad the contents of a group.

strings.attributes.quote.description: Whether to use a single or double quote for attribute values. If set to null, leaves attribute value quotes as they are found.

strings.quote.description: Whether to use a single or double quote for strings. If set to null, leaves string quotes as they are found.

struct.empty_padding.description: When true, non-empty structs are padded with spaces.

struct.multiline.element_count.description: When a struct has this number of elements or more, print it onto multiple lines.

struct.multiline.leading_comma.description: Whether to use a leading comma when an struct is printed on multiple lines.

struct.multiline.min_length.description: No matter how many elements an struct has, if it is shorter than this length, keep it on one line.

struct.padding.description: Whether to pad non-empty structs with spaces.

struct.separator.description: The key value separator to use in structs - it must contain either a single `:` or `=` and be no more than 3 characters in length.

tab_indent.description: Whether to indent using tab characters or not.
